thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger wrong to play David Ospina v Bayern Munich, says Pat Nevin | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger wrong to play David Ospina v Bayern Munich, says Pat Nevin | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger wrong to play David Ospina v Bayern Munich, says Pat Nevin | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 9:13 am Arsene Wenger criticised for big game against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Arsene Wenger took a big risk by fielding David Ospina in goal for Arsenal against Bayern Munich last week, according to former Chelsea winger Pat Nevin. Manchester United star makes surprise return to training ahead of EFL Cup final 
The Colombia international has often got the nod over first-choice ‘keeper Petr Cech in Arsenal’s cup games this season, but Nevin admits he was ‘amazed’ to see Wenger use him in such a big game. 
Cech is the far more experience of the two goalkeepers, having won the Champions League against Bayern at the Allianz Arena during his time at Chelsea – as Nevin was keen to point out in his column for the Blues’ official site. David Ospina didn’t have a great game at Bayern (Picture: Getty) Ospina replaced Cech in goal at the Allianz Arena (Picture: Getty) 
‘Just last week I was over in Munich for the Arsenal game and was amazed that Arsene Wenger decided to allow Ospina to continue in goal, as he has all along in the Champions League, instead of Petr Cech,’ Nevin said. 
‘Now David Ospina is a fine keeper but Cech is better, has pretty good history in the Champions League and a specifically good experience in the Allianz Arena against Bayern Munich!
